block.p: Around Town
Museums and Sites

AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Central Park West and 79th Street. Through Jan. 6, ''Mythic Creatures: Dragons, Unicorns & Mermaids.'' Through April 6, 2008, ''Beyond,'' an exhibition of more than 30 large-format photographs of Earth's planetary neighbors, in the museum's Imax Gallery. Through Jan. 6, ''The Unknown Audubons: Mammals of North America,'' a display of more than 40 artworks depicting animals. Through May 28, ''The Butterfly Conservatory: Tropical Butterflies Alive in Winter,'' a display with hundreds of butterflies in a re-creation of their natural habitat. Through Aug. 19, ''Gold,'' with coins, jewelry and other artifacts. In the Imax theater, ''Dinosaurs Alive!,'' a film about museum paleontologists in search of dinosaur remains. Timed tickets to ''Mythic Creatures,'' ''Gold'' and ''The Butterfly Conservatory'' include museum admission. (212) 769-5100 or (212) 769-5200; $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for 12 and younger. Imax movie tickets, which include museum admission, are $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for children 12 and under. Suggested museum admission: $14; $10.50 for students and 60+; children, $8. Combination tickets, including museum and Rose Center admission and the Hayden Planetarium space show (''Cosmic Collisions''): $22; $16.50 for students and 60+; $13 for 12 and younger; under 2, free. Admission that includes all activities: $30; $23 for students and 60+; $19 for 12 and younger. The Rose Center is open until 8:45 p.m. for ''Starry Nights: Fridays Under the Sphere,'' with jazz, a cash bar and tapas, on the first Friday of every month. Tonight at 6 and 7:30, BeatleJazz, with Dave Kikoski on piano and Brian Melvin on percussion. Museum hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (to 8:45 p.m. on Fridays). amnh.org.

HISTORIC RICHMOND TOWN Staten Island Historical Society, 441 Clarke Avenue, Richmond Town. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., a Community Day Celebration, with crafts and trade demonstrations and old-fashioned games. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. (718) 351-1611. $5; $4 for 62+; $3.50 for students and 5 to 17; free for children under 5 and members.

MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, Fifth Avenue at 103rd Street. Today at 2 p.m., ''Behind the Scenes in East Harlem Walking Tour'' covers architectural and cultural treasures; reservations required: (212) 534-1672, Ext. 3395; $9. Tonight at 7, a reading of the play ''Your God's Not Coming,'' written and directed by Akin Salawu and presented by the New Heritage Theater Group. Sunday at 3 p.m., a performance of songs from the Spanish Civil War. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. (212) 534-1672. Suggested admission: $9; $5 for students and 62+; free for children under 12; $20 for families; free on Sundays, 10 a.m. to noon. mcny.org.
Gardens

BROOKLYN BOTANIC GARDEN, 1000 Washington Avenue, Prospect Heights. Through June 30, ''June Is Rose Month,'' with thousands of blooming varieties and special events. Tuesdays through Fridays, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, Sundays and holidays (except Labor Day), 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. (718) 623-7200. $8; $4 for students and 65+; free for under 12 and members at all times and for 65+ on Fridays. Free admission all day on Tuesdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. bbg.org.

NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN, Southern Boulevard and 200th Street, Bedford Park, the Bronx. Rose Month, with activities tomorrow and Sunday. Through Sept. 16, ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' a conservatory display. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Combination ticket, which includes admission for ''Caribbean Gardens,'' access to all other garden sites, tours, tram tours and events: $18; students and 62+, $16; children 2 to 13, $5; free for children under 2. General garden grounds admission: $6; $3 for 62+; $2 for students; $1 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Tram tours daily, every 20 minutes. (718) 817-8700. Conservatory admission: $5; $4 for students and 62+; $3 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Grounds admission free on Wednesdays and 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. Parking, $10; nybg.org.
Events

BANG ON A CAN MARATHON, World Financial Center, Winter Garden, West Street, south of Vesey Street, Lower Manhattan. Beginning tomorrow night at 8 and running through Sunday night at 10, performances by the Bang on a Can All-Stars, the World Saxophone Quartet and others. rivertoriver.com. Free.

BUSHWICK OPEN STUDIOS AND ART FESTIVAL, Brooklyn. A weekend of studio visits and other events, beginning tomorrow at 11:30 a.m. with a parade on McKibben Street, between Bushwick Avenue and White Street, and ending with a festival in Maria Hernandez Park. www.artsinbushwick.org. Free.
CARING COMMUNITY STREET FAIR, Washington Square North, between Avenue of the Americas and University Place, Greenwich Village. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

EGG ROLLS AND EGG CREAMS BLOCK PARTY, Eldridge Street, between Canal and Division Streets, Lower East Side. Sunday, noon to 4 p.m., with Chinese and Jewish music, dance and food. Sponsored by the Eldridge Street Project. (212) 219-0888, Ext. 302. Free.
LEXINGTON AVENUE FESTIVAL, from 42nd to 57th Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
LOCAL PRODUCE FESTIVAL OF THE PERFORMING ARTS, sponsored by Spoke the Hub, today through Sunday, with activities in the streets and gardens of Park Slope, Brooklyn. (718) 408-3243; spokethehub.org.

19TH ANNUAL HAMILTON HEIGHTS HOUSE AND GARDEN TOUR, Sunday, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., meeting at the Hamilton Grange National Memorial, 287 Convent Avenue, at 141st Street. Sponsored by the Hamilton Heights Homeowners Association. hamiltonheights.org/housetour. $25.

PATHMARK MULTICULTURAL ARTS FESTIVAL, South Street Seaport, Pier 17, Fulton and South Streets, Lower Manhattan. Tomorrow, AsiaFest; Sunday, Latin Dance Spectacular. Both noon to 5 p.m. (866) 894-1812; pathmark.com. Free.
PHILIPPINE PARADE AND FESTIVAL, Madison Avenue, from 41st to 27th Streets, Sunday at 11 a.m., followed by a festival at 27th Street that will run until 6 p.m.
RIVERSIDE CHURCH FESTIVAL, East side of Broadway, from 116th to 120th Streets, Morningside Heights. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

TOGETHER IN NEW YORK COMMUNITY FESTIVAL, Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., Asser Levy Park, Ocean Parkway and Surf Avenue, Brighton Beach, Brooklyn. With Russian music, dance, crafts and food. (212) 687-6118, Ext. 201.
SECOND AVENUE STREET FAIRS Two on Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., from 23rd to 34th Streets and 66th to 86th Streets.
31ST ANNUAL AMERICAN CRAFTS FESTIVAL, plazas of Lincoln Center. Tomorrow, noon to 9 p.m., and Sunday, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sponsored by the American Concern for Art and Craftsmanship.

37TH PROSPECT LEFFERTS GARDENS HOUSE AND GARDEN TOUR, in Brooklyn, Sunday, noon to 5 p.m. Sponsored by the Lefferts Manor Association. $20 in advance; $25 on Sunday. (718) 284-6210 or (718) 462-0024 or leffertsmanor.org for information on tickets and tour starting point.
2007 REEBOK GRAND PRIX, Icahn Stadium, Randalls Island. Tomorrow at 5 p.m., an international track and field event. reebokgrandprix.com. $20 to $40.
WASHINGTON SQUARE OUTDOOR ART EXHIBIT, on the sidewalks north, south and east of Washington Square Park, in Greenwich Village. Tomorrow and Sunday, noon to 6 p.m.
Walking Tours

ADVENTURE ON A SHOESTRING Tomorrow at 3 p.m. ''Attractive Astoria'' includes an optional meal in this largely Greek neighborhood in Queens, meeting on the southwest corner of 30th Avenue and 31st Street; food additional. (212) 265-2663. $5.
BERNIE'S NEW YORK Sunday at 2 p.m., ''Dignity and Elegance of Yesteryear,'' meeting on the northwest corner of Riverside Drive and 72nd Street. (718) 655-1883. $10.

BROOKLYN CENTER FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT Sunday at 1 p.m., ''Picturesque Marble Hill and Kingsbridge,'' two Bronx neighborhoods, meeting on the southeast corner of Broadway and 225th Street. (718) 788-8500, Ext. 208. $13; members, $10; 62+ and students, $8.
IN DEPTH WALKING TOURS Sunday at 10 a.m., ''Revolution in the Streets'' tours 1775 New York, meeting at Fraunces Tavern, Pearl and Broad Streets, Lower Manhattan. (917) 607-9019. $20.

MUNICIPAL ART SOCIETY Sunday at 11 a.m., ''Trinity Church Cemetery Uptown,'' in Washington Heights, meeting in front of the OC Bakery and Cafe, 11 Edward M. Morgan Place, near Broadway and 157th Street. (212) 439-1049; mas.org. $15; $13 for members.
OUTDOORS CLUB Sunday at 11 a.m., a four-mile walk across the Bronx, meeting in Manhattan on the southeast corner of Lexington Avenue and 42nd Street. (718) 784-3643. $3.

WEEKSVILLE WALKABOUT Tomorrow at 1 p.m., a tour of this historic Brooklyn neighborhood, meeting in front of Boys and Girls High School, 1700 Fulton Avenue, near Utica Avenue. Sponsored by the Weeksville Heritage Center. (718) 756-5250. $15.
Recreation

ANNUAL CENTRAL PARK CHALLENGE OF YAI NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES Tomorrow, with a five-kilometer run at 9 a.m. (registration, 7:30 a.m.; fee, $20), followed by a three-kilometer walk at 9:45 a.m. (registration, 8:30 a.m.; fee, $10), near the Naumberg Bandshell, midpark at 72nd Street. Also, children's races at 11:15 a.m. and children's activities from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Proceeds benefit programs for people with developmental and learning disabilities. (877) 924-9255; yai.org; fee, $20 for two or more children.

BREATHE NYC: ASTHMA WALK 2007, Battery Park, Lower Manhattan. A three-mile walk up the Battery Promenade, beginning tomorrow at 10 a.m. in the park; registration, 9 a.m. Sponsored by the American Lung Association of the City of New York. (800) 586-4872; alany.org.

JAPAN DAY @ CENTRAL PARK Sunday at 8 a.m., a four-mile run to kick off a day of activities highlighting Japanese culture at Rumsey Playfield; the run begins on the park's East Drive at 68th Street. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners. (212) 860-4455; japandaynyc.org. Advance registration: $30; $20 for club members; $14 for 18 and younger and 62+. Race day registration: $35; $25 for club members; $15 for 18 and younger and 62+.

LAWN BOWLING LESSONS, Central Park, Bowling Green, reachable from East and West 66th Streets. Sunday at 11 a.m. Participants should wear sneakers or soft-sole shoes. Sponsored by the New York Lawn Bowling Club. (212) 831-6011. Free.
19TH ANNUAL SPECIAL OLYMPICS OF NEW YORK, Riverbank State Park, Riverside Drive and 145th Street. Tomorrow, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. specialolympicsnewyork.org.

TAKE A WALK, NEW YORK! A series of walks in the five boroughs. Tomorrow at 10 a.m. ''Brooklyn's Left Bank'' includes the old Brooklyn Navy Yard, Greenpoint and Williamsburg, meeting at the street entrance to the York Street subway stop on the F train. (212) 228-3126; walkny.org. Free.
Information about events to be considered for inclusion in Spare Times can be sent to weekend@nytimes.com.
Around Town
Museums and Sites

AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Central Park West and 79th Street. Through Jan. 6, ''Mythic Creatures: Dragons, Unicorns & Mermaids.'' Through April 6, 2008, ''Beyond,'' an exhibition of more than 30 large-format photographs of Earth's planetary neighbors, in the museum's Imax Gallery. Through Jan. 6, ''The Unknown Audubons: Mammals of North America,'' a display of more than 40 artworks depicting animals. Through May 28, ''The Butterfly Conservatory: Tropical Butterflies Alive in Winter,'' a display with hundreds of butterflies in a re-creation of their natural habitat. Through Aug. 19, ''Gold,'' with coins, jewelry and other artifacts. In the Imax theater, ''Dinosaurs Alive!,'' a film about museum paleontologists in search of dinosaur remains. Timed tickets to ''Mythic Creatures,'' ''Gold'' and ''The Butterfly Conservatory'' include museum admission. (212) 769-5100 or (212) 769-5200; $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for 12 and younger. Imax movie tickets, which include museum admission, are $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for children 12 and under. Suggested museum admission: $14; $10.50 for students and 60+; children, $8. Combination tickets, including museum and Rose Center admission and the Hayden Planetarium space show (''Cosmic Collisions''): $22; $16.50 for students and 60+; $13 for 12 and younger; under 2, free. Admission that includes all activities: $30; $23 for students and 60+; $19 for 12 and younger. HISTORIC RICHMOND TOWN Staten Island Historical Society, 441 Clarke Avenue, Richmond Town. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., a Community Day Celebration, with crafts and trade demonstrations and old-fashioned games. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. (718) 351-1611. $5; $4 for 62+; $3.50 for students and 5 to 17; free for children under 5 and members.

MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, Fifth Avenue at 103rd Street. Tonight at 7, a reading of the play ''Your God's Not Coming,'' written and directed by Akin Salawu and presented by the New Heritage Theater Group. Sunday at 3 p.m., a performance of songs from the Spanish Civil War. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. (212) 534-1672. Suggested admission: $9; $5 for students and 62+; free for children under 12; $20 for families; free on Sundays, 10 a.m. to noon. mcny.org.
Gardens

BROOKLYN BOTANIC GARDEN, 1000 Washington Avenue, Prospect Heights. Through June 30, ''June Is Rose Month,'' with thousands of blooming varieties and special events. Tuesdays through Fridays, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, Sundays and holidays (except Labor Day), 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. (718) 623-7200. $8; $4 for students and 65+; free for under 12 and members at all times and for 65+ on Fridays. Free admission all day on Tuesdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. bbg.org.

NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN, Southern Boulevard and 200th Street, Bedford Park, the Bronx. Rose Month, with activities tomorrow and Sunday. Through Sept. 16, ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' a conservatory display. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Combination ticket, which includes admission for ''Caribbean Gardens,'' access to all other garden sites, tours, tram tours and events: $18; students and 62+, $16; children 2 to 13, $5; free for children under 2. General garden grounds admission: $6; $3 for 62+; $2 for students; $1 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Tram tours daily, every 20 minutes. (718) 817-8700. Conservatory admission: $5; $4 for students and 62+; $3 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Grounds admission free on Wednesdays and 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. Parking, $10; nybg.org.
Events

BANG ON A CAN MARATHON, World Financial Center, Winter Garden, West Street, south of Vesey Street, Lower Manhattan. Beginning tomorrow night at 8 and running through Sunday night at 10, performances by the Bang on a Can All-Stars, the World Saxophone Quartet and others. rivertoriver.com. Free.

BUSHWICK OPEN STUDIOS AND ART FESTIVAL, Brooklyn. A weekend of studio visits and other events, beginning tomorrow at 11:30 a.m. with a parade on McKibben Street, between Bushwick Avenue and White Street, and ending with a festival in Maria Hernandez Park. www.artsinbushwick.org. Free.
CARING COMMUNITY STREET FAIR, Washington Square North, between Avenue of the Americas and University Place, Greenwich Village. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

EGG ROLLS AND EGG CREAMS BLOCK PARTY, Eldridge Street, between Canal and Division Streets, Lower East Side. Sunday, noon to 4 p.m., with Chinese and Jewish music, dance and food. Sponsored by the Eldridge Street Project. (212) 219-0888, Ext. 302. Free.
LEXINGTON AVENUE FESTIVAL, from 42nd to 57th Streets. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
LOCAL PRODUCE FESTIVAL OF THE PERFORMING ARTS, sponsored by Spoke the Hub, today through Sunday, with activities in the streets and gardens of Park Slope, Brooklyn. (718) 408-3243; spokethehub.org.

19TH ANNUAL HAMILTON HEIGHTS HOUSE AND GARDEN TOUR, Sunday, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., meeting at the Hamilton Grange National Memorial, 287 Convent Avenue, at 141st Street. Sponsored by the Hamilton Heights Homeowners Association. hamiltonheights.org/housetour. $25.

PATHMARK MULTICULTURAL ARTS FESTIVAL, South Street Seaport, Pier 17, Fulton and South Streets, Lower Manhattan. Tomorrow, AsiaFest; Sunday, Latin Dance Spectacular. Both noon to 5 p.m. (866) 894-1812; pathmark.com. Free.
PHILIPPINE PARADE AND FESTIVAL, Madison Avenue, from 41st to 27th Streets, Sunday at 11 a.m., followed by a festival at 27th Street that will run until 6 p.m.
RIVERSIDE CHURCH FESTIVAL, East side of Broadway, from 116th to 120th Streets, Morningside Heights. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

TOGETHER IN NEW YORK COMMUNITY FESTIVAL, Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., Asser Levy Park, Ocean Parkway and Surf Avenue, Brighton Beach, Brooklyn. With Russian music, dance, crafts and food. (212) 687-6118, Ext. 201.
SECOND AVENUE STREET FAIRS Two on Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., from 23rd to 34th Streets and 66th to 86th Streets.
31ST ANNUAL AMERICAN CRAFTS FESTIVAL, plazas of Lincoln Center. Tomorrow, noon to 9 p.m., and Sunday, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sponsored by the American Concern for Art and Craftsmanship.

37TH PROSPECT LEFFERTS GARDENS HOUSE AND GARDEN TOUR, in Brooklyn, Sunday, noon to 5 p.m. Sponsored by the Lefferts Manor Association. $20 in advance; $25 on Sunday. (718) 284-6210 or (718) 462-0024 or leffertsmanor.org for information on tickets and tour starting point.
2007 REEBOK GRAND PRIX, Icahn Stadium, Randalls Island. Tomorrow at 5 p.m., an international track and field event. reebokgrandprix.com. $20 to $40.
WASHINGTON SQUARE OUTDOOR ART EXHIBIT, on the sidewalks north, south and east of Washington Square Park, in Greenwich Village. Tomorrow and Sunday, noon to 6 p.m.
Walking Tours

ADVENTURE ON A SHOESTRING Tomorrow at 3 p.m. ''Attractive Astoria'' includes an optional meal in this largely Greek neighborhood in Queens, meeting on the southwest corner of 30th Avenue and 31st Street; food additional. (212) 265-2663. $5.
BERNIE'S NEW YORK Sunday at 2 p.m., ''Dignity and Elegance of Yesteryear,'' meeting on the northwest corner of Riverside Drive and 72nd Street. (718) 655-1883. $10.

BROOKLYN CENTER FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT Sunday at 1 p.m., ''Picturesque Marble Hill and Kingsbridge,'' two Bronx neighborhoods, meeting on the southeast corner of Broadway and 225th Street. (718) 788-8500, Ext. 208. $13; members, $10; 62+ and students, $8.
IN DEPTH WALKING TOURS Sunday at 10 a.m., ''Revolution in the Streets'' tours 1775 New York, meeting at Fraunces Tavern, Pearl and Broad Streets, Lower Manhattan. (917) 607-9019. $20.

MUNICIPAL ART SOCIETY Sunday at 11 a.m., ''Trinity Church Cemetery Uptown,'' in Washington Heights, meeting in front of the OC Bakery and Cafe, 11 Edward M. Morgan Place, near Broadway and 157th Street. (212) 439-1049; mas.org. $15; $13 for members.
OUTDOORS CLUB Sunday at 11 a.m., a four-mile walk across the Bronx, meeting in Manhattan on the southeast corner of Lexington Avenue and 42nd Street. (718) 784-3643. $3.

WEEKSVILLE WALKABOUT Tomorrow at 1 p.m., a tour of this historic Brooklyn neighborhood, meeting in front of Boys and Girls High School, 1700 Fulton Avenue, near Utica Avenue. Sponsored by the Weeksville Heritage Center. (718) 756-5250. $15.
Recreation

ANNUAL CENTRAL PARK CHALLENGE OF YAI NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES Tomorrow, with a five-kilometer run at 9 a.m. (registration, 7:30 a.m.; fee, $20), followed by a three-kilometer walk at 9:45 a.m. (registration, 8:30 a.m.; fee, $10), near the Naumberg Bandshell, midpark at 72nd Street. Also, children's races at 11:15 a.m. and children's activities from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Proceeds benefit programs for people with developmental and learning disabilities. (877) 924-9255; yai.org; fee, $20 for two or more children.

BREATHE NYC: ASTHMA WALK 2007, Battery Park, Lower Manhattan. A three-mile walk up the Battery Promenade, beginning tomorrow at 10 a.m. in the park; registration, 9 a.m. Sponsored by the American Lung Association of the City of New York. (800) 586-4872; alany.org.

JAPAN DAY @ CENTRAL PARK Sunday at 8 a.m., a four-mile run to kick off a day of activities highlighting Japanese culture at Rumsey Playfield; the run begins on the park's East Drive at 68th Street. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners. (212) 860-4455; japandaynyc.org. Advance registration: $30; $20 for club members; $14 for 18 and younger and 62+. Race day registration: $35; $25 for club members; $15 for 18 and younger and 62+.

LAWN BOWLING LESSONS, Central Park, Bowling Green, reachable from East and West 66th Streets. Sunday at 11 a.m. Participants should wear sneakers or soft-sole shoes. Sponsored by the New York Lawn Bowling Club. (212) 831-6011. Free.
19TH ANNUAL SPECIAL OLYMPICS OF NEW YORK, Riverbank State Park, Riverside Drive and 145th Street. Tomorrow, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. specialolympicsnewyork.org.

TAKE A WALK, NEW YORK! A series of walks in the five boroughs. Tomorrow at 10 a.m. ''Brooklyn's Left Bank'' includes the old Brooklyn Navy Yard, Greenpoint and Williamsburg, meeting at the street entrance to the York Street subway stop on the F train. (212) 228-3126; walkny.org. Free.
Information about events to be considered for inclusion in Spare Times can be sent to weekend@nytimes.com.
